   20: -module(beam_validator_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   25: 	 compiler_bug/1,stupid_but_valid/1,
   26: 	 xrange/1,yrange/1,stack/1,call_last/1,merge_undefined/1,
   27: 	 uninit/1,
   28: 	 dead_code/1,
   29: 	 overwrite_catchtag/1,overwrite_trytag/1,accessing_tags/1,bad_catch_try/1,
   30: 	 cons_guard/1,
   31: 	 freg_range/1,freg_uninit/1,
   32: 	 bad_bin_match/1,bad_dsetel/1,
   33: 	 state_after_fault_in_catch/1,no_exception_in_catch/1,
   34: 	 undef_label/1,illegal_instruction/1,failing_gc_guard_bif/1,
   35: 	 map_field_lists/1,cover_bin_opt/1,
   36: 	 val_dsetel/1,bad_tuples/1,bad_try_catch_nesting/1,
   37:          receive_stacked/1,aliased_types/1,type_conflict/1,
   38:          infer_on_eq/1,infer_dead_value/1,infer_on_ne/1,
   39:          branch_to_try_handler/1,call_without_stack/1,
   40:          receive_marker/1,safe_instructions/1,
   41:          missing_return_type/1,will_succeed/1,
   42:          bs_saved_position_units/1,parent_container/1,
   43:          container_performance/1,
   44:          infer_relops/1,
   45:          not_equal_inference/1,bad_bin_unit/1,singleton_inference/1,
   46:          inert_update_type/1,range_inference/1,
   47:          bif_inference/1,too_many_arguments/1]).
   48: 
   49: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   50: 
   51: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_atom(Case), is_list(Config) ->
   52:     Config.
   53: 
   54: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_atom(Case), is_list(Config) ->
   55:     ok.
   56: 
   57: suite() ->
   58:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   59:      {timetrap,{minutes,10}}].
   60: 
   61: all() -> 
   62:     [{group,p}].
   63: 
   64: groups() -> 
   65:     [{p,test_lib:parallel(),
   66:       [compiler_bug,stupid_but_valid,xrange,
   67:        yrange,stack,call_last,merge_undefined,uninit,
   68:        dead_code,
   69:        overwrite_catchtag,overwrite_trytag,accessing_tags,
   70:        bad_catch_try,cons_guard,freg_range,freg_uninit,
   71:        bad_bin_match,bad_dsetel,
   72:        state_after_fault_in_catch,no_exception_in_catch,
   73:        undef_label,illegal_instruction,failing_gc_guard_bif,
   74:        map_field_lists,cover_bin_opt,val_dsetel,
   75:        bad_tuples,bad_try_catch_nesting,
   76:        receive_stacked,aliased_types,type_conflict,
   77:        infer_on_eq,infer_dead_value,infer_on_ne,
   78:        branch_to_try_handler,call_without_stack,
   79:        receive_marker,safe_instructions,
   80:        missing_return_type,will_succeed,
   81:        bs_saved_position_units,parent_container,
   82:        container_performance,infer_relops,
   83:        not_equal_inference,bad_bin_unit,singleton_inference,
   84:        inert_update_type,range_inference,
   85:        bif_inference,too_many_arguments]}].
   86: 
   87: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   88:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   89:     Config.
   90: 
   91: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   92:     ok.
   93: 
   94: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   95: 	Config.
   96: 
   97: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   98: 	Config.
   99: 
  100: compiler_bug(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  101:     %% Check that the compiler returns an error if we try to
  102:     %% assemble one of the bad '.S' files.
  103:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  104:     File = filename:join(Data, "compiler_bug"),
  105:     error = compile:file(File, [from_asm,report_errors,time]),
  106: 
  107:     %% Make sure that the error was reported by
  108:     %% the beam_validator module.
  109:     {error,
  110:      [{"compiler_bug",
  111:        [{_Pos,beam_validator,_}]}],
  112:      []} = compile:file(File, [from_asm,return_errors,time]),
  113:     ok.
  114: 
  115: %% The following code is stupid but it should compile.
  116: stupid_but_valid(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  117:     AnAtom = nisse,
  118:     try setelement(5, setelement(6, AnAtom, value), another_value) of
  119: 	Term -> ct:fail({what_happened,Term})
  120:     catch
  121: 	error:badarg -> ok
  122:     end,
  123:     ok.
  124: 
  125: xrange(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  126:     Errors = do_val(xrange, Config),
  127:     [{{t,sum_1,2},
  128:       {{bif,'+',{f,0},[{x,-1},{x,1}],{x,0}},4,
  129:        {bad_register,{x,-1}}}},
  130:      {{t,sum_2,2},
  131:       {{bif,'+',{f,0},[{x,0},{x,1023}],{x,0}},4,limit}},
  132:      {{t,sum_3,2},
  133:       {{bif,'+',{f,0},[{x,0},{x,1}],{x,-1}},4,
  134:        {bad_register,{x,-1}}}},
  135:      {{t,sum_4,2},
  136:       {{bif,'+',{f,0},[{x,0},{x,1}],{x,1023}},4,limit}}] = Errors,
  137:     ok.
  138: 
  139: yrange(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  140:     Errors = do_val(yrange, Config),
  141:     [{{t,sum_1,2},
  142:       {{move,{x,1},{y,-1}},5,
  143:        {bad_register,{y,-1}}}},
  144:      {{t,sum_2,2},
  145:       {{bif,'+',{f,0},[{x,0},{y,1024}],{x,0}},7,
  146:        limit}},
  147:      {{t,sum_3,2},
  148:       {{move,{x,1},{y,1024}},5,limit}},
  149:      {{t,sum_4,2},
  150:       {{move,{x,1},{y,-1}},5,
  151:        {bad_register,{y,-1}}}}] = Errors,
  152:     ok.
  153: 
  154: stack(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  155:     Errors = do_val(stack, Config),
  156:     [{{t,a,2},{return,9,{stack_frame,2}}},
  157:      {{t,b,2},{{deallocate,2},4,{allocated,none}}},
  158:      {{t,bad_1,0},{{allocate,2,10},4,{{x,9},not_live}}},
  159:      {{t,bad_2,0},{{move,{y,0},{x,0}},6,{unassigned,{y,0}}}},
  160:      {{t,c,2},{{deallocate,2},10,{allocated,none}}},
  161:      {{t,d,2},
  162:       {{allocate,2,2},5,{existing_stack_frame,{size,2}}}},
  163:      {{t,e,2},{{deallocate,5},6,{allocated,2}}}] = Errors,
  164:     ok.
  165: 
  166: call_last(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  167:     Errors = do_val(call_last, Config),
  168:     [{{t,a,1},
  169:       {{call_last,1,{f,8},2},9,{allocated,1}}},
  170:      {{t,b,1},
  171:       {{call_ext_last,2,{extfunc,lists,seq,2},2},10,{allocated,1}}},
  172:      {{t,baz,2},
  173:       {{call_ext_only,2,{extfunc,erlang,put,2}},5,{allocated,0}}},
  174:      {{t,biz,2},
  175:       {{call_only,2,{f,10}},5,{allocated,0}}}] = Errors,
  176:     ok.
  177: 
  178: call_without_stack(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  179:     Errors = do_val(call_without_stack, Config),
  180:     [{{t,local,2},
  181:         {{call,2,{f,2}},4,{allocated,none}}},
  182:      {{t,remote,2},
  183:         {{call_ext,2,{extfunc,lists,seq,2}},4,{allocated,none}}}] = Errors,
  184:     ok.
  185: 
  186: merge_undefined(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  187:     Errors = do_val(merge_undefined, Config),
  188:     [{{t,undecided,2},
  189:       {{label,11},
  190:        19,
  191:        {unsafe_stack,{y,1},
  192:         #{{y,0} := uninitialized,
  193:           {y,1} := uninitialized}}}},
  194:      {{t,uninitialized,2},
  195:       {{call_ext,2,{extfunc,io,format,2}},
  196:        17,
  197:        {uninitialized_reg,{y,1}}}}] = Errors,
  198:     ok.
  199: 
  200: uninit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  201:     Errors = do_val(uninit, Config),
  202:     [{{t,sum_1,2},
  203:       {{move,{y,0},{x,0}},5,{uninitialized_reg,{y,0}}}},
  204:      {{t,sum_2,2},
  205:       {{call,1,{f,8}},5,{uninitialized_reg,{y,0}}}},
  206:      {{t,sum_3,2},
  207:       {{bif,'+',{f,0},[{x,0},{y,0}],{x,0}},
  208:        7,
  209:        {unassigned,{y,0}}}}] = Errors,
  210:     ok.
  211: 
  212: dead_code(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  213:     [] = do_val(dead_code, Config),
  214:     ok.
  215: 
  216: overwrite_catchtag(Config) when is_list(Config) ->

  218:     [{{overwrite_catchtag,foo,1},

  227: 
  228: accessing_tags(Config) when is_list(Config) ->

  230:     [{{accessing_tags,bar,1},
  231:       {{move,{y,0},{x,0}},6,{trytag,_}}},
  232:      {{accessing_tags,foo,1},
  233:       {{move,{y,0},{x,0}},6,{catchtag,_}}}] = Errors,

  235: 
  236: bad_catch_try(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  237:     Errors = do_val(bad_catch_try, Config),
  238:     [{{bad_catch_try,bad_1,1},
  239:       {{'catch',{x,0},{f,3}},
  240:        5,{invalid_tag_register,{x,0}}}},
  241:      {{bad_catch_try,bad_2,1},
  242:       {{catch_end,{x,9}},
  243:        8,{invalid_tag_register,{x,9}}}},
  244:      {{bad_catch_try,bad_3,1},
  245:       {{catch_end,{y,1}},9,{invalid_tag,{y,1},{t_atom,[kalle]}}}},
  246:      {{bad_catch_try,bad_4,1},
  247:       {{'try',{x,0},{f,15}},6,{invalid_tag_register,{x,0}}}},
  248:      {{bad_catch_try,bad_5,1},
  249:       {{try_case,{y,1}},13,{invalid_tag,{y,1},any}}},
  250:      {{bad_catch_try,bad_6,1},
  251:       {{move,{integer,1},{y,1}},8,
  252:        {invalid_store,{y,1}}}}] = Errors,
  253:     ok.
  254: 
  255: cons_guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  256:     Errors = do_val(cons, Config),
  257:     [{{cons,foo,1},
  258:       {{get_list,{x,0},{x,1},{x,2}},
  259:        5,
  260:        {bad_type,{needed,{t_cons,any,any}},{actual,any}}}}] = Errors,
  261:     ok.
  262: 
  263: freg_range(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  264:     Errors = do_val(freg_range, Config),
  265:     [{{t,sum_1,2},
  266:       {{bif,fadd,{f,0},[{fr,-1},{fr,1}],{fr,0}},
  267:        4,
  268:        {bad_source,{fr,-1}}}},
  269:      {{t,sum_2,2},
  270:       {{bif,fadd,{f,0},[{fr,0},{fr,1024}],{fr,0}},
  271:        5,
  272:        {uninitialized_reg,{fr,1024}}}},
  273:      {{t,sum_3,2},
  274:       {{bif,fadd,{f,0},[{fr,0},{fr,1}],{fr,-1}},
  275:        6,
  276:        {bad_register,{fr,-1}}}},
  277:      {{t,sum_4,2},
  278:       {{bif,fadd,{f,0},[{fr,0},{fr,1}],{fr,1024}},
  279:        6,
  280:        limit}}] = Errors,
  281:     ok.
  282: 
  283: freg_uninit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  284:     Errors = do_val(freg_uninit, Config),
  285:     [{{t,sum_1,2},
  286:       {{bif,fadd,{f,0},[{fr,0},{fr,1}],{fr,0}},
  287:        5,
  288:        {uninitialized_reg,{fr,1}}}},
  289:      {{t,sum_2,2},
  290:       {{bif,fadd,{f,0},[{fr,0},{fr,1}],{fr,0}},
  291:        8,
  292:        {uninitialized_reg,{fr,0}}}}] = Errors,
  293:     ok.
  294: 
  295: bad_bin_match(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  296:     [{{t,t,1},{return,5,{match_context,{x,0}}}}] =
  297: 	do_val(bad_bin_match, Config),
  298:     ok.
  299: 
  300: bad_dsetel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  301:     Errors = do_val(bad_dsetel, Config),
  302:     [{{t,t,1},
  303:       {{set_tuple_element,{x,1},{x,0},1},
  304:        17,
  305:        illegal_context_for_set_tuple_element}}] = Errors,
  306:     ok.
  307: 
  308: state_after_fault_in_catch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  309:     Errors = do_val(state_after_fault_in_catch, Config),
  310:     [{{state_after_fault_in_catch,badmatch,1},
  311:       {{move,{x,1},{x,0}},9,{uninitialized_reg,{x,1}}}},
  312:      {{state_after_fault_in_catch,case_end,1},
  313:       {{move,{x,1},{x,0}},9,{uninitialized_reg,{x,1}}}},
  314:      {{state_after_fault_in_catch,if_end,1},
  315:       {{move,{x,1},{x,0}},9,{uninitialized_reg,{x,1}}}},
  316:      {{t,foo,1},
  317:       {{move,{x,1},{x,0}},10,{uninitialized_reg,{x,1}}}}] = Errors,
  318:     ok.
  319: 
  320: no_exception_in_catch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  321:     Errors = do_val(no_exception_in_catch, Config),
  322:     [{{no_exception_in_catch,nested_of_1,4},
  323:       {{try_case_end,{x,0}},152,ambiguous_catch_try_state}}] = Errors,
  324:     ok.
  325: 
  326: undef_label(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  327:     M = {undef_label,
  328: 	 [{t,1}],
  329: 	 [],
  330: 	 [{function,t,1,2,
  331: 	   [{label,1},
  332: 	    {func_info,{atom,undef_label},{atom,t},1},
  333: 	    {label,2},
  334: 	    {test,is_eq_exact,{f,42},[{x,0},{atom,x}]},
  335: 	    {move,{atom,ok},{x,0}},
  336: 	    return]},
  337: 	  {function,x,1,17,
  338: 	   [{label,3},
  339: 	    {func_info,{atom,undef_label},{atom,x},1},
  340: 	    {label,4},
  341: 	    return]}],
  342: 	 5},
  343:     Errors = beam_val(M),
  344:     [{{undef_label,t,1},{undef_labels,[42]}},
  345:      {{undef_label,x,1},invalid_function_header}] = Errors,
  346:     ok.
  347: 
  348: illegal_instruction(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  349:     M = {illegal_instruction,
  350: 	 [{t,1},{x,1},{y,0}],
  351: 	 [],
  352: 	 [{function,t,1,2,
  353: 	   [{label,1},
  354: 	    {func_info,{atom,illegal_instruction},{atom,t},1},
  355: 	    {label,2},
  356: 	    {my_illegal_instruction,{x,0}},
  357: 	    return]},
  358: 	  {function,x,1,4,
  359: 	   [{label,3},
  360: 	    bad_func_info,
  361: 	    {label,4},
  362: 	    {my_illegal_instruction,{x,0}},
  363: 	    return]},
  364: 	  {function,y,0,17,[]}],
  365: 	 5},
  366:     Errors = beam_val(M),
  367:     [{{illegal_instruction,t,1},
  368:       {{my_illegal_instruction,{x,0}},4,unknown_instruction}},
  369:      {{illegal_instruction,x,1},invalid_function_header},
  370:      {{illegal_instruction,y,0},invalid_function_header}] = Errors,
  371:     ok.
  372: 
  373: %% The beam_validator used to assume that a GC guard BIF could
  374: %% do a garbage collection even if it failed. That assumption
  375: %% is not correct, and will cause the beam_validator to reject
  376: %% valid programs such as this test case.
  377: %%
  378: %% (Thanks to Kiran Khaladkar.)
  379: %%
  380: failing_gc_guard_bif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  381:     ok = process_request(lists:seq(1, 36)),
  382:     error = process_request([]),
  383:     error = process_request(not_a_list),
  384:     ok.
  385: 
  386: process_request(ConfId) ->
  387:     case process_request_foo(ConfId) of
  388: 	false ->
  389: 	    if
  390: 		length(ConfId) == 36 ->
  391: 		    Response = ok;
  392: 		true ->
  393: 		    Response = error
  394: 	    end
  395:     end,
  396:     process_request_bar(self(), [Response]).
  397: 
  398: process_request_foo(_) ->
  399:     false.
  400: 
  401: process_request_bar(Pid, [Response]) when is_pid(Pid) ->
  402:     Response.
  403: 
  404: map_field_lists(Config) ->
  405:     Errors = do_val(map_field_lists, Config),
  406:     [{{map_field_lists,x,1},
  407:       {{test,has_map_fields,{f,1},{x,0},{list,[{atom,a},{atom,a}]}},
  408:        6,
  409:        keys_not_unique}},
  410:      {{map_field_lists,y,1},
  411:       {{test,has_map_fields,{f,3},{x,0},{list,[]}},
  412:        6,
  413:        empty_field_list}}
  414:     ] = Errors.
  415: 
  416: %% Coverage and smoke test of beam_validator.
  417: cover_bin_opt(_Config) ->
  418:     Ms = [beam_utils_SUITE,
  419: 	  bs_match_SUITE,
  420: 	  bs_bincomp_SUITE,
  421: 	  bs_bit_binaries_SUITE,
  422: 	  bs_utf_SUITE],
  423:     test_lib:p_run(fun try_bin_opt/1, Ms),
  424:     ok.
  425: 
  426: try_bin_opt(Mod) ->
  427:     try
  428: 	do_bin_opt(Mod)
  429:     catch
  430: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
  431: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n",
  432: 		      [Mod,Class,Error,Stk]),
  433: 	    error
  434:     end.
  435: 
  436: do_bin_opt(Mod) ->
  437:     Beam = code:which(Mod),
  438:     {ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,
  439: 	       {raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} =
  440: 	beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  441:     {ok,Mod,Asm} = compile:forms(Abstr, ['S']),
  442:     do_bin_opt(Mod, Asm).
  443: 
  444: do_bin_opt(Mod, Asm) ->
  445:     do_bin_opt(fun enable_bin_opt/1, Mod, Asm),
  446:     do_bin_opt(fun remove_bs_start_match/1, Mod, Asm),
  447:     do_bin_opt(fun remove_bs_save/1, Mod, Asm),
  448:     do_bin_opt(fun destroy_ctxt/1, Mod, Asm),
  449:     do_bin_opt(fun destroy_save_point/1, Mod, Asm),
  450:     ok.
  451: 
  452: do_bin_opt(Transform, Mod, Asm0) ->
  453:     Asm = Transform(Asm0),
  454:     case compile:forms(Asm, [from_asm,no_postopt,return]) of
  455: 	{ok,Mod,Code,_Warnings} when is_binary(Code) ->
  456: 	    ok;
  457: 	{error,Errors0,_} ->
  458: 	    %% beam_validator must return errors, not simply crash,
  459: 	    %% when illegal code is found.
  460: 	    ModString = atom_to_list(Mod),
  461: 	    [{ModString,Errors}] = Errors0,
  462: 	    _ = [verify_bin_opt_error(E) || E <- Errors],
  463: 	    ok
  464:     end.
  465: 
  466: verify_bin_opt_error({beam_validator,_}) ->
  467:     ok.
  468: 
  469: enable_bin_opt(Module) ->
  470:     transform_is(fun enable_bin_opt_body/1, Module).
  471: 
  472: enable_bin_opt_body([_,{'%',{no_bin_opt,_Reason,_Anno}}|Is]) ->
  473:     enable_bin_opt_body(Is);
  474: enable_bin_opt_body([I|Is]) ->
  475:     [I|enable_bin_opt_body(Is)];
  476: enable_bin_opt_body([]) ->
  477:     [].
  478: 
  479: remove_bs_start_match(Module) ->
  480:     transform_remove(fun({test,bs_start_match2,_,_,_,_}) -> true;
  481: 			(_) -> false
  482: 		     end, Module).
  483: 
  484: remove_bs_save(Module) ->
  485:     transform_remove(fun({bs_save2,_,_}) -> true;
  486: 			(_) -> false
  487: 		     end, Module).
  488: 
  489: destroy_save_point(Module) ->
  490:     transform_i(fun do_destroy_save_point/1, Module).
  491: 
  492: do_destroy_save_point({I,Ctx,_Point})
  493:   when I =:= bs_save2; I =:= bs_restore2 ->
  494:     {I,Ctx,42};
  495: do_destroy_save_point(I) ->
  496:     I.
  497: 
  498: destroy_ctxt(Module) ->
  499:     transform_i(fun do_destroy_ctxt/1, Module).
  500: 
  501: do_destroy_ctxt({bs_save2=I,Ctx,Point}) ->
  502:     {I,destroy_reg(Ctx),Point};
  503: do_destroy_ctxt({bs_restore2=I,Ctx,Point}) ->
  504:     {I,destroy_reg(Ctx),Point};
  505: do_destroy_ctxt({bs_context_to_binary=I,Ctx}) ->
  506:     {I,destroy_reg(Ctx)};
  507: do_destroy_ctxt(I) ->
  508:     I.
  509: 
  510: destroy_reg({Tag,N}) ->
  511:     case rand:uniform() of
  512: 	R when R < 0.6 ->
  513: 	    {Tag,N+1};
  514: 	_ ->
  515: 	    {y,N+1}
  516:     end.
  517: 
  518: bad_tuples(Config) ->
  519:     Errors = do_val(bad_tuples, Config),
  520:     [{{bad_tuples,heap_overflow,1},
  521:       {{put_tuple2,{x,0},{list,[{atom,ok},{x,0}]}},6,
  522:        {heap_overflow,{left,2},{wanted,3}}}}] = Errors,
  523: 
  524:     ok.
  525: 
  526: bad_try_catch_nesting(Config) ->
  527:     Errors = do_val(bad_try_catch_nesting, Config),
  528:     [{{bad_try_catch_nesting,main,2},
  529:       {{'try',{y,2},{f,3}},
  530:        9,
  531:        {bad_try_catch_nesting,{y,2},[{{y,1},{trytag,[5]}}]}}}] = Errors,
  532:     ok.
  533: 
  534: receive_stacked(Config) ->
  535:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  536:     Errors = do_val(Mod, Config),
  537:     [{{receive_stacked,f1,0},
  538:       {{loop_rec_end,{f,3}},
  539:        19,
  540:        {fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  541:      {{receive_stacked,f2,0},
  542:       {{test_heap,3,0},12,{fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  543:      {{receive_stacked,f3,0},
  544:       {{test_heap,3,0},12,{fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  545:      {{receive_stacked,f4,0},
  546:       {{test_heap,3,0},12,{fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  547:      {{receive_stacked,f5,0},
  548:       {{loop_rec_end,{f,23}},
  549:        23,
  550:        {fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  551:      {{receive_stacked,f6,0},
  552:       {{gc_bif,byte_size,{f,29},0,[{y,_}],{x,0}},
  553:        14,
  554:        {fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  555:      {{receive_stacked,f7,0},
  556:       {{loop_rec_end,{f,33}},
  557:        22,
  558:        {fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  559:      {{receive_stacked,f8,0},
  560:       {{loop_rec_end,{f,38}},
  561:        22,
  562:        {fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  563:      {{receive_stacked,m1,0},
  564:       {{loop_rec_end,{f,43}},
  565:        21,
  566:        {fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  567:      {{receive_stacked,m2,0},
  568:       {{loop_rec_end,{f,48}},
  569:        32,
  570:        {fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}}] = Errors,
  571: 
  572:     %% Compile the original source code as a smoke test.
  573:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  574:     Base = atom_to_list(Mod),
  575:     File = filename:join(Data, Base),
  576:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  577: 
  578:     ok.
  579: 
  580: aliased_types(Config) ->
  581:     Seq = lists:seq(1, 5),
  582:     1 = aliased_types_1(Seq, Config),
  583: 
  584:     {1,1} = aliased_types_2(Seq),
  585:     {42,none} = aliased_types_2([]),
  586: 
  587:     gurka = aliased_types_3([gurka]),
  588:     gaffel = aliased_types_3([gaffel]),
  589: 
  590:     ok.
  591: 
  592: %% ERL-735: validator failed to track types on aliased registers, rejecting
  593: %% legitimate optimizations.
  594: %%
  595: %%    move x0 y0
  596: %%    bif hd L1 x0
  597: %%    get_hd y0     %% The validator failed to see that y0 was a list
  598: %%
  599: aliased_types_1(Bug, Config) ->
  600:     if
  601:         Config =/= [gurka, gaffel] -> %% Pointless branch.
  602:             _ = hd(Bug),
  603:             lists:seq(1, 5),
  604:             hd(Bug)
  605:     end.
  606: 
  607: %% ERL-832: validator failed to realize that a Y register was a cons.
  608: aliased_types_2(Bug) ->
  609:     Res = case Bug of
  610:               [] -> id(42);
  611:               _ -> hd(Bug)
  612:           end,
  613:     {Res,case Bug of
  614:              [] -> none;
  615:              _ -> hd(Bug)
  616:          end}.
  617: 
  618: %% ERL-832 part deux; validator failed to realize that an aliased register was
  619: %% a cons.
  620: aliased_types_3(Bug) ->
  621:     List = [Y || Y <- Bug],
  622:     case List of
  623:         [] -> Bug;
  624:         _ ->
  625:             if
  626:                 hd(List) -> a:a();
  627:                 true -> ok
  628:             end,
  629:             hd(List)
  630:     end.
  631: 
  632: 
  633: %% ERL-867; validation proceeded after a type conflict, causing incorrect types
  634: %% to be joined.
  635: 
  636: -record(r, { e1 = e1, e2 = e2 }).
  637: 
  638: type_conflict(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  639:     {e1, e2} = type_conflict_1(#r{}),
  640:     ok.
  641: 
  642: type_conflict_1(C) ->
  643:     Src = id(C#r.e2),
  644:     TRes = try id(Src) of
  645:                R -> R
  646:            catch
  647:                %% C:R can never match, yet it assumed that the type of 'C' was
  648:                %% an atom from here on.
  649:                C:R -> R
  650:            end,
  651:     {C#r.e1, TRes}.
  652: 
  653: %% ERL-886; validation failed to infer types on both sides of '=:='
  654: 
  655: infer_on_eq(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  656:     {ok, gurka} = infer_on_eq_1(id({gurka})),
  657:     {ok, gaffel} = infer_on_eq_2(id({gaffel})),
  658:     {ok, elefant} = infer_on_eq_3(id({elefant})),
  659:     {ok, myra} = infer_on_eq_4(id({myra})),
  660:     ok.
  661: 
  662: infer_on_eq_1(T) ->
  663:     1 = erlang:tuple_size(T),
  664:     {ok, erlang:element(1, T)}.
  665: 
  666: infer_on_eq_2(T) ->
  667:     Size = erlang:tuple_size(T),
  668:     Size = 1,
  669:     {ok, erlang:element(1, T)}.
  670: 
  671: infer_on_eq_3(T) ->
  672:     true = 1 =:= erlang:tuple_size(T),
  673:     {ok, erlang:element(1, T)}.
  674: 
  675: infer_on_eq_4(T) ->
  676:     true = erlang:tuple_size(T) =:= 1,
  677:     {ok, erlang:element(1, T)}.
  678: 
  679: %% ERIERL-348; types were inferred for dead values, causing validation to fail.
  680: 
  681: -record(idv, {key}).
  682: 
  683: infer_dead_value(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  684:     a = idv_1({a, b, c, d, e, f, g}, {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0}),
  685:     b = idv_1({a, b, c, d, 0, 0, 0}, {a, b, c, d, 0, 0, 0}),
  686:     c = idv_1({0, 0, 0, 0, 0, f, g}, {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, f, g}),
  687:     error = idv_1(gurka, gaffel),
  688: 
  689:     ok = idv_2(id(#idv{})),
  690: 
  691:     ok.
  692: 
  693: idv_1({_A, _B, _C, _D, _E, _F, _G},
  694:       {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0}) ->
  695:     a;
  696: idv_1({A, B, C, D,_E, _F, _G}=_Tuple1,
  697:       {A, B, C, D, 0, 0, 0}=_Tuple2) ->
  698:     b;
  699: idv_1({_A, _B, _C, _D, _E, F, G},
  700:       {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, F, G}) ->
  701:     c;
  702: idv_1(_A, _B) ->
  703:     error.
  704: 
  705: %% ERL-998; type inference for select_val (#b_switch{}) was more clever than
  706: %% that for is_ne_exact (#b_br{}), sometimes failing validation when the type
  707: %% optimization pass acted on the former and the validator got the latter.
  708: 
  709: -record(ion, {state}).
  710: 
  711: infer_on_ne(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  712:     #ion{state = closing} = ion_1(#ion{ state = id(open) }),
  713:     #ion{state = closing} = ion_close(#ion{ state = open }),
  714:     ok.
  715: 
  716: ion_1(State = #ion{state = open}) -> ion_2(State);
  717: ion_1(State = #ion{state = closing}) -> ion_2(State).
  718: 
  719: ion_2(State = #ion{state = open}) -> ion_close(State);
  720: ion_2(#ion{state = closing}) -> ok.
  721: 
  722: ion_close(State = #ion{}) -> State#ion{state = closing}.
  723: 
  724: %% ERL-995: The first solution to ERIERL-348 was incomplete and caused
  725: %% validation to fail when living values depended on delayed type inference on
  726: %% "dead" values.
  727: 
  728: idv_2(State) ->
  729:     Flag = (State#idv.key == undefined),
  730:     case id(gurka) of
  731:         {_} -> id([Flag]);
  732:         _ -> ok
  733:     end,
  734:     if
  735:         Flag -> idv_called_once(State);
  736:         true -> ok
  737:     end.
  738: 
  739: idv_called_once(_State) -> ok.
  740: 
  741: %% Direct jumps to try/catch handlers crash the emulator and must fail
  742: %% validation. This is provoked by OTP-15945.
  743: 
  744: branch_to_try_handler(Config) ->

  746:     [{{branch_to_try_handler,main,1},

  748:        13,
  749:        {illegal_branch,try_handler,3}}}] = Errors,
  750:     ok.
  751:

  761:      {{receive_marker,t3,1},
  762:       {return,_,
  763:        {return_in_receive,entered_loop}}}] = Errors,
  764: 
  765:     ok.
  766:

  768: %% instructions like is_eq_exact could throw.
  769: safe_instructions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  770:     Errors = do_val(safe_instructions, Config),
  771: 
  772:     [] = Errors,
  773: 
  774:     ok.
  775: 
  776: missing_return_type(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  777:     %% ERL-1161: the validator didn't know that is_map_key always returns a
  778:     %% bool.
  779:     Map = #{ hello => there },
  780:     true = mrt_1(true),
  781:     false = mrt_1(false),
  782:     true = mrt_1(is_map_key(id(hello), Map)),
  783:     false = mrt_1(is_map_key(id(there), Map)),
  784: 
  785:     ok.
  786: 
  787: mrt_1(Bool) ->
  788:     true = is_boolean(Bool),
  789:     Bool.

  869: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  870: 
  871: transform_remove(Remove, Module) ->
  872:     transform_is(fun(Is) -> [I || I <- Is, not Remove(I)] end, Module).
  873: 
  874: transform_i(Transform, Module) ->
  875:     transform_is(fun(Is) -> [Transform(I) || I <- Is] end, Module).
  876: 
  877: transform_is(Transform, {Mod,Exp,Imp,Fs0,Lc}) ->
  878:     Fs = [transform_is_1(Transform, F) || F <- Fs0],
  879:     {Mod,Exp,Imp,Fs,Lc}.
  880: 
  881: transform_is_1(Transform, {function,N,A,E,Is0}) ->
  882:     Is = Transform(Is0),
  883:     {function,N,A,E,Is}.
  884: 
  885: do_val(Mod, Config) ->
  886:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  887:     Base = atom_to_list(Mod),
  888:     File = filename:join(Data, Base),
  889:     case compile:file(File, [from_asm,no_postopt,return_errors]) of
  890: 	{error,L,[]} ->
  891: 	    [{Base,Errors0}] = L,
  892: 	    Errors = [E || {_Pos,beam_validator,E} <- Errors0],
  893: 	    _ = [io:put_chars(beam_validator:format_error(E)) ||
  894: 		    E <- Errors],
  895: 	    Errors;
  896: 	{ok,Mod} ->
  897: 	    []
  898:     end.
  899: 
  900: beam_val(M) ->
  901:     Name = atom_to_list(element(1, M)),
  902:     {error,[{Name,Errors0}]} = beam_validator:validate(M, strong),
  903:     Errors = [E || {_Pos,beam_validator,E} <- Errors0],
  904:     _ = [io:put_chars(beam_validator:format_error(E)) ||
  905: 	    E <- Errors],
  906:     Errors.
  907: 
  908: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  909: 
  910: val_dsetel(_Config) ->
  911:     self() ! 13,
  912:     {'EXIT',{{try_clause,participating},_}} = (catch night(0)),
  913:     ok.
  914: 
  915: night(Turned) ->
  916:     receive
  917: 	13 ->
  918: 	    try participating of engine -> 16 after false end
  919:     end,
  920:     %% The setelement/3 call is unreachable.
  921:     Turned(setelement(#{true => Turned},
  922: 		      participating(Turned, "suit", 40, []),
  923: 		      Turned < Turned)),
  924:     ok.
  925: 
  926: participating(_, _, _, _) -> ok.
  927: 
  928: will_succeed(_Config) ->
  929:     ok = will_succeed_1(body),
  930: 
  931:     self() ! whatever,
  932:     error = will_succeed_2(),
  933: 
  934:     self() ! whatever,
  935:     error = will_succeed_3(),
  936: 
  937:     ok.
  938: 
  939: %% map_get was known as returning 'none', but 'will_succeed' still returned
  940: %% 'maybe' causing validation to continue, eventually exploding when the 'none'
  941: %% value was used.
  942: %%
  943: %% +no_ssa_opt
  944: will_succeed_1(body) when map_get(girl, #{friend => node()}); [], community ->
  945:     case $q and $K of
  946:         _V0 ->
  947:             0.1825965401179273;
  948:         0 ->
  949:             state#{[] => 0.10577334580729858, $J => 0}
  950:     end;
  951: will_succeed_1(body) ->
  952:     ok.
  953: 
  954: %% The apply of 42:name/0 was known to fail, but 'will_succeed' still
  955: %% returned 'maybe', causing validation to continue and fail because
  956: %% of the jump to the try_case instruction.
  957: will_succeed_2() ->
  958:     try
  959:         receive
  960:             _ ->
  961:                 42
  962:         end:name()
  963:     catch
  964:         _:_ ->
  965:             error
  966:     end.
  967: 
  968: will_succeed_3() ->
  969:     try
  970:         receive
  971:             _ ->
  972:                 42
  973:         end:name(a, b)
  974:     catch
  975:         _:_ ->
  976:             error
  977:     end.
  978: 
  979: %% ERL-1426: When a value was extracted from a tuple, subsequent type tests did
  980: %% not update the type of said tuple.
  981: 
  982: -record(pc, {a}).
  983: 
  984: parent_container(_Config) ->
  985:     ok = pc_1(id(#pc{a=true})).
  986: 
  987: pc_1(#pc{a=A}=R) ->
  988:     case A of
  989:         true -> ok;
  990:         false -> ok
  991:     end,
  992:     ok = pc_2(R).
  993: 
  994: pc_2(_R) ->
  995:     ok.
  996: 
  997: %% GH-5915: The following function took an incredibly long time to validate.
  998: container_performance(Config) ->
  999:     case Config of
 1000:         ({b,_}) -> {k1};
 1001:         ({a,{b,_}}) -> {k2};
 1002:         ({a,{a,{b,_}}}) -> {k3};
 1003:         ({a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}) -> {k4};
 1004:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}) -> {k5};
 1005:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}) -> {k6};
 1006:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}) -> {k7};
 1007:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}) -> {k8};
 1008:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}) -> {k9};
 1009:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k10};
 1010:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k11};
 1011:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k12};
 1012:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k13};
 1013:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k14};
 1014:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k15};
 1015:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k16};
 1016:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k17};
 1017:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k18};
 1018:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k19};
 1019:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k20};
 1020:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k21};
 1021:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k22};
 1022:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k23};
 1023:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k24};
 1024:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k25};
 1025:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k26};
 1026:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k27};
 1027:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k28};
 1028:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k29};
 1029:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k30};
 1030:         _ -> ok
 1031:     end.
 1032: 
 1033: %% Type inference was half-broken for relational operators, being implemented
 1034: %% for is_lt/is_ge instructions but not the {bif,RelOp} form.
 1035: infer_relops(_Config) ->
 1036:     [lt = infer_relops_1(N) || N <- lists:seq(0,3)],
 1037:     [ge = infer_relops_1(N) || N <- lists:seq(4,7)],
 1038:     ok.
 1039: 
 1040: infer_relops_1(N) ->
 1041:     true = N >= 0,
 1042:     Below4 = N < 4,
 1043:     id(N), %% Force Below4 to use the {bif,'<'} form instead of is_lt
 1044:     case Below4 of
 1045:         true -> infer_relops_true(Below4, N);
 1046:         false -> infer_relops_false(Below4, N)
 1047:     end.
 1048: 
 1049: infer_relops_true(_, _) -> lt.
 1050: infer_relops_false(_, _) -> ge.
 1051: 
 1052: %% OTP-18365: A brainfart in inference for '=/=' inverted the results.
 1053: not_equal_inference(_Config) ->
 1054:     {'EXIT', {function_clause, _}} = (catch not_equal_inference_1(id([0]))),
 1055:     ok.
 1056: 
 1057: not_equal_inference_1(X) when (X /= []) /= is_port(0 div 0) ->
 1058:     [X || _ <- []].
 1059: 
 1060: bad_bin_unit(_Config) ->
 1061:     {'EXIT', {function_clause,_}} = catch bad_bin_unit_1(<<1:1>>),
 1062:     [] = bad_bin_unit_2(),
 1063:     ok.
 1064: 
 1065: bad_bin_unit_1(<<X:((ok > {<<(true andalso ok)>>}) orelse 1)>>) ->
 1066:     try
 1067:         bad_bin_unit_1_a()
 1068:     after
 1069:         -(X + bad_bin_unit_1_b(not ok)),
 1070:         try
 1071:             ok
 1072:         catch
 1073:             _ ->
 1074:                 ok;
 1075:             _ ->
 1076:                 ok;
 1077:             _ ->
 1078:                 ok;
 1079:             _ ->
 1080:                 ok;
 1081:             _ ->
 1082:                 ok;
 1083:             _ ->
 1084:                 ok
 1085:         end
 1086:     end.
 1087: 
 1088: bad_bin_unit_1_a() -> ok.
 1089: bad_bin_unit_1_b(_) -> ok.
 1090: 
 1091: bad_bin_unit_2() ->
 1092:    [
 1093:        ok
 1094:        || <<X:(is_number(<<(<<(0 bxor 0)>>)>>) orelse 1)>> <= <<>>,
 1095:        #{X := _} <- ok
 1096:    ].
 1097: 
 1098: %% GH-6962: Type inference with singleton types in registers was weaker than
 1099: %% inference on their corresponding literals.
 1100: singleton_inference(Config) ->
 1101:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1102: 
 1103:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1104:     File = filename:join(Data, "singleton_inference.erl"),
 1105: 
 1106:     {ok, Mod} = compile:file(File, [no_copt, no_bool_opt, no_ssa_opt]),
 1107: 
 1108:     ok = Mod:test(),
 1109: 
 1110:     ok.
 1111: 
 1112: %% GH-6969: A type was made concrete even though that added no additional
 1113: %% information.
 1114: inert_update_type(_Config) ->
 1115:     hello(<<"string">>, id(42)).
 1116: 
 1117: hello(A, B) ->
 1118:     mike([{sys_period, {A, B}}, {some_atom, B}]).
 1119: 
 1120: mike([Head | _Rest]) -> joe(Head).
 1121: 
 1122: joe({Name, 42}) -> Name;
 1123: joe({sys_period, {A, _B}}) -> {41, 42, A}.
 1124: 
 1125: range_inference(_Config) ->
 1126:     ok = range_inference_1(id(<<$a>>)),
 1127:     ok = range_inference_1(id(<<0>>)),
 1128:     ok = range_inference_1(id(<<1114111/utf8>>)),
 1129: 
 1130:     ok.
 1131: 
 1132: range_inference_1(<<X/utf8>>) ->
 1133:     case 9223372036854775807 - abs(X) of
 1134:         Y when X < Y ->
 1135:             ok;
 1136:         9223372036854775807 ->
 1137:             ok;
 1138:         -2147483648 ->
 1139:             ok
 1140:     end.
 1141: 
 1142: bif_inference(_Config) ->
 1143:     ok = bif_inference_is_bitstring(id(<<>>), id(<<>>)),
 1144:     error = bif_inference_is_bitstring(id(a), id(a)),
 1145: 
 1146:     ok = bif_inference_is_function(id(fun id/1), id(fun id/1)),
 1147:     ok = bif_inference_is_function(true, true),
 1148:     error = bif_inference_is_function(id(fun id/1), a),
 1149:     error = bif_inference_is_function(a, a),
 1150: 
 1151:     ok.
 1152: 
 1153: bif_inference_is_bitstring(A, A) when A andalso ok; is_bitstring(A) ->
 1154:     ok;
 1155: bif_inference_is_bitstring(_, _) ->
 1156:     error.
 1157: 
 1158: bif_inference_is_function(A, A)  when A orelse ok; is_function(A) ->
 1159:     ok;
 1160: bif_inference_is_function(_, _) ->
 1161:     error.
 1162: 
 1163: %% GH-9113: We didn't reject funs, comprehensions, and the likes which exceeded
 1164: %% the argument limit.
 1165: too_many_arguments(_Config) ->
 1166:     M = {too_many_arguments,
 1167:          [{t,256},{t,0}],
 1168:          [],
 1169:          [{function,t,256,2,
 1170:            [{label,1},
 1171:             {func_info,{atom,too_many_arguments},{atom,t},256},
 1172:             {label,2},
 1173:             return]},
 1174:           {function,t,0,4,
 1175:            [{label,3},
 1176:             %% Mismatching arity.
 1177:             {func_info,{atom,too_many_arguments},{atom,t},5},
 1178:             {label,4},
 1179:             return]}],
 1180:          5},
 1181:     Errors = beam_val(M),
 1182:     [{{too_many_arguments,t,256},too_many_arguments},
 1183:      {{too_many_arguments,t,0},invalid_function_header}] = Errors,
 1184:     ok.
 1185: 
 1186: id(I) ->
 1187:     I.
